programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming action in the NBA, evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each team while breaking down the pivotal matchups; coverage includes exclusive interviews, insightful commentary and special features.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Notre Dame beat Pittsburgh, 55-54, to advance behind 11 points from Tae Davis; North Carolina won its last four meetings with Notre Dame after a 74-73 win in the lone season matchup on Jan. 4 behind 27 points and six rebounds from Ian Jackson.

programme.title: NBA Courtside
programme.desc: Players get prepared for the upcoming game through their warm-up routines, as cameras go around the arena to see the fans get excited with tipoff nearing and capture the pregame energy before the starting five lineups are announced.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Oklahoma City claimed a 105-92 victory over Boston in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 5, led by 33 points and 11 rebounds from Shai Gilgeous-Alexander; Jayson Tatum posted 26 points and 10 rebounds for the Celtics in the loss.

programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.desc: Virginia won its last 13 meetings with Georgia Tech, including a 75-61 victory in the lone season matchup on Feb. 8 behind 20 points from Isaac McKneely and 18 from Dai Dai Ames; Nathan George led the Yellow Jackets with 20 points.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Lamar/Nicholls winner goes up against top-seeded McNeese, which defeated Northwestern State, 83-64, in the semifinals to advance to the championship behind a game-high 24 points from Javohn Garcia and 14 points from DJ Richards Jr.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Montana won its last six meetings with Idaho, including a 73-71 win on Jan. 4 behind 18 points from both Malik Moore and Money Williams before a 72-67 victory on Jan. 20 behind 18 points from Brandon Whitney and 12 from Jensen Bradtke.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Cal defeated Virginia Tech, 82-73, to advance behind 29 points from Andrej Stojakovic; Stanford won both season meetings with Cal behind Maxime Raynaud, who is second in the ACC in scoring with 20.1 ppg and first in rebounding with 10.9 rpg.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle

programme.desc: The latest news and reports around the NFL are discussed in detail with a panel of expert analysts weighing in on the hottest issues, while veteran football reporters provide up-to-date information from team headquarters across the league.

programme.desc: An in-depth newsmagazine featuring a talented pool of reporters and producers from ESPN, presenting profiles of well-known athletes and coaches as well as investigative reports and cutting-edge stories on emerging and established sports.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Albany and Bryant split their two season meetings, including an 89-79 Bulldogs win on Jan. 16 behind 22 points from Rafael Pinzon, who is second in America East scoring, before a 68-63 Great Danes win on Feb. 6 behind 22 points from Byron Joshua.
